title: Paper Airplane
description: The employees hold a paper airplane competition, Andy gets an acting role in a workplace safety video, and Jim and Pam's marriage tensions continue to build.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh. Hey, champions.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Good morning.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Quater finals in an hour.  Hope you got some sleep cause I am going to be haunting your nightmares tonight.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I did. I got some really good sleep.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Did you? [pushes pencil cup at Erin]

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [grabs pencils out of cup quickly as cup falls] Bzzz.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yesterday was the first round of a branch wide paper airplane contest.  It was being sponsored by Weyer-Hammer Paper in an effort to get us to sell more of their new product Airstream Deluxe A4, the Cadillac of paper. It's not so easy on the environment, if you know what I mean. [whispers] Practically made of plastic.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: We started with sixteen brave aviators. Some use skill [cut to Kevin flying paper airplane], others relied on showmanship [cut to Dwight throwing airplane at Nate with an apple on his head] others seem not to comprehend what a paper airplane is. [cut to Creed throwing a melon] And of course, there was the odd moment of heartbreak and disaster.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Hey I left my glasses down here somewhere. Crossing through, beep beep. [Pam's plane hit Toby in the eye]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Ow! Ow!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I didn't see you! You should have yelled "Crossing!"

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [crying] I'm sorry!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok, so is that my spot?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: We are now down to an elite eight.  Well, seven and Toby.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [Reading from script] Be careful of that beaker, it contains dangerous acid!

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: It does not say dangerous. And there's no exclamation point.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Well I'm just trying to bring some life to it.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Last week I got an agent and uh, this week I got a movie. HRPDC chemical handling protocols.  It's gonna be seen by tons of workers in the industrial chemical community. One of whom could have a cousin whose brother's Brad Pitt.  And boom, next thing you know, I'm in Moneyballs Two.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Andy?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Go away, we're running lines.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: You wanted to see the gooey eye.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Oh yeah. Alright, get over here. I am so freaked out by things going into eyes. I just- wow. [moves to lift Toby's eye patch] Uggggh! I can't even, I'm so freaked out by that, just go. Go go go go go.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Alright, it's getting gooier so we'll just do it later.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, Ok. [Closes door] Alright. Where were we?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Something full of acid.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And remember:  Do not attempt to extinguish a chemical fire with water. You will only exacerbate the flame. The dangerous flame.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [claps] That was great man. Alright, I'm out of here.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: W-w-w-wait. Stop stop stop. Don't go anywhere.  I just need to find more colors. Let's do it six more times.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey. I just wanted to say that you woke up early with the kids and let me sleep and I really appreciate that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thank you. I appreciate that you appreciate that.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: So, we had couple's therapy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No shame in that. Get it all out in the open.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And we have homework.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yes, we are supposed to look for every chance to acknowledge and appreciate each other's sacrifices. Because I need to appreciate what Pam's been doing to run the house while I'm in Philly.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And we're also supposed to speak our truths.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Mmhm.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Because if I had spoken my truth sooner about not wanting to move to Philly, then maybe we wouldn't have had this opportunity for couple's therapy.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, we're supposed to call everything we don't want to do "opportunities."

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Heads up everyone. If you really need something from me today, let's get it done tomorrow.  Carla Fern got me a gig.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Hey!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Who's Carla Fern?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Who is Carla Fern? Well, wow. Uh, she's my agent and my drill sargent. And one of my best friends. Oh, and Oscar, I already figured it out. If I have to get emotional in the film, I'm just going to think about you getting dumped by the Senator.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Why wouldn't you use your own life? Erin just dumped you.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Little raw. Not cool Oscar.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: But you just!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Not cool.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Hey. Day two. Drama in the warehouse skies. This is Robert from Weyer-Hammer Paper, who will be joining us to judge the final rounds.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Who's pumped for the quarter finals, huh?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I'm pumped!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Clark's a dead man.

quotes.speaker: Robert
quotes.text: Alright. Sounds like somebody wants to walk away with this. [holds up large check for $2,000]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh my god!

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: Whoa.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Nellie you didn't tell us we could win money.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh yes I did, I told you all. It was..um, cause that's an awful lot of money for me to forget.

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: Not one of us remembers you saying anything about two thousand dollars.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I forgot. I completely forgot. But at least now that large piece of cardboard that man was carrying around makes sense.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Nellie, this is a competition.  Please take it seriously.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh please. [Dwight watches Angela folding paper airplane]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Me? Oh, I'm fine. I mean, sure, times are leaner now that I'm separated from the Senator.  But my new studio apartment is just fine [camera shows small cluttered space with excessive cats and Phillip crying] for me.. and Phillip... and Tinky... and Crinklepuss, and Bandit 2, and Pawlick Baggins, and Lady Aragorn and their 10 kittens.

quotes.speaker: Phillip
quotes.text: [cries]

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Come here, come here. Let's go.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I had a chance with Dwight, but I didn't take it. And if I went back now, when I'm broke and he just inherited a farm, I'd be one of those gold-digging tramps you read about that try to bag a farmer.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I offered myself to Angela and she turned me down. If she changes her mind, the next move is hers. I'm with Esther now.  She's younger than Angela, sturdier, more comfortable with the scent of a manured field. Let's be honest. When it came to manured fields, Angela was at best indifferent.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Oh, wide wings, interesting.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hey. Why don't you back off?[looks at Pete]...I mean best of luck to you in the competition.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Growing up in an orphanage, you have to fight other kids. For everything. Snacks, pillows, parents. I'm kinda worried about Pete seeing that side of me. I once ripped greedy Susan's pigtail right off her head. Just for a handful of Crispix.

quotes.speaker: Carla Fern
quotes.text: Are you in that paper documentary too?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Yep.

quotes.speaker: Carla Fern
quotes.text: Do you need an agent?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No. He's- I mean, you've never acted in anything before. He's just my entourage.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I was in The Whiz in high school.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: That's the cleaky clacker! He clicks that and then the guy says "action."

quotes.speaker: Carla Fern
quotes.text: Hey, I made them get you a chair.  All my clients sit.

quotes.speaker: Woman
quotes.text: Can I take your picture?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I guess it's starting. Um, yeah.  Of course. Yeah sure.  Tell you what. I'll put my arm around you and then I can take it-

quotes.speaker: Woman
quotes.text: We just need a picture of the top of your head in case we burn some of your hair off.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Got it. [lowers head to show hair, but keeps looking up just as she tries to take the picture]

quotes.speaker: Woman
quotes.text: No, if you could just keep it down until..

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Sorry.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: OK, next up we have two creatures great and small. Kevin versus Angela.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Hey, that is a really nice plane.  You make that yourself?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Uh huh.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, what am I thinking? Of course you made that yourself. Cause it's in the rules that you have to fold your own plane.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Of course.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Kevin, did you make that yourself?

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yes. In a way. From one that I bought on Craigslist.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh man.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I call for a refold!

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Really? [to Dwight] Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: This is flatter.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: It's a piece of paper. You fold it into an airplane.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Ok, that's enough.  This is the end of the ring now. You have to pick one.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I can't. I love them all too much. And, none of them fly. So that makes it harder.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: You have to choose one now.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Fine. [throws plane, doesn't fly]

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Angela advances.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [clapping] Whoo!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Was Dwight rooting for me? Hmm. I hadn't noticed.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: I'm not giving up.  I'm going to keep making planes until one of them flies. Like Wilbur and Orville Redenbacher.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: An Earl Grey tea for the lady.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, thank you. I acknowledge and appreciate that you went out of your way to get me tea.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you. I like being appreciated. But, to speak my truth, it wasn't out of the way because I felt like a tea anyway. So, one trip.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, to speak my truth, I switched to coffee in March.  There's a new espresso machine. But I still acknowledge and appreciate the gesture.

quotes.speaker: Director
quotes.text: We are rolling and...action!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [Happily] This video is to demonstrate the HPRDC chemical handling protocols. These protocols could save you from severe injury, even death.

quotes.speaker: Producer
quotes.text: Ok, um, stop. Um, why are you smiling so much?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Just made a character choice to be a scientist who really likes what he does and enjoys his job.

quotes.speaker: Director
quotes.text: Ok, well maybe no smiling on this one.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So how do you want, how should I do it?

quotes.speaker: Director
quotes.text: I don't know, just like you're reporting the news or something. Ok?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [ridiculous news voice] This video is to demonstrate the HPRDC chemical handling protocols.

quotes.speaker: Director
quotes.text: Ok.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: It's Tom Brokaw, it's a newscaster.

quotes.speaker: Director
quotes.text: Who was that?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Tom Brokaw!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Come on Clark!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Come on Clark. [Clark throws plane, Erin throws plane it goes much farther]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Whoa!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah! Oh! Eat it piggy! Eat it! Oink oink oink oink!

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: We've still gotta work together, so we should keep it civil.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [Snorts and grunts] I can't hear what you said. [snorting, grunting] You got your slop? [Squeals]

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: You know what, this is completely unnecessary.  You already won...

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Erin! Erin! Just stop.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: What?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Relax.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Next up we have Dwight and Phyllis.

quotes.speaker: Bob Vance
quotes.text: You can do it baby!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: No you can't baby! [to Dwight, whispers] Good luck.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Watch and learn.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Wow.

quotes.speaker: Group
quotes.text: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Dwight defeats Phyllis, Dwight you are through to the semi-finals.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Whoo!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, Esther.

quotes.speaker: Esther
quotes.text: Hey.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What are you- [Esther kisses him] You're here early.

quotes.speaker: Esther
quotes.text: Yeah, I plucked the chickens extra fast cause I knew I was seeing you tonight. There might just be a little feather in your nuggets or a little bit of meat inside of your pillow.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I like a little feather in my nuggets. [both laugh]

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Alright ladies and gentlemen, we are down to the final four. Dwight, Erin, Angela and god only knows how, but Toby. One of you will walk away with two thousand dollars.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah!

quotes.speaker: Director
quotes.text: Ok here you have just knocked over the beaker, the chemicals splashed in your eye.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Which is insanely painful.

quotes.speaker: Director
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: And I've already picked a few childhood memories to tap in to, to really express that pain.

quotes.speaker: Director
quotes.text: That's great. So what you're gonna do then is come over here to the eye washing station and then just kinda flush out your eyes.  You know, get the chemicals out. Alright?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: So I just lean over this thing and then you'll add the water special effect later?

quotes.speaker: Director
quotes.text: What water special effect?

quotes.speaker: Producer
quotes.text: Yeah, yeah just hold your lids open with one hand and let the stream bathe your eyeballs.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm not comfortable doing my own stunts. I'll get nude if you want me to, I'll go full Lena Dunham but I-

quotes.speaker: Director
quotes.text: Dude, we don't need you to go nude, OK? So just do the eyewash, Ok? That's all we're asking.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Darryl, what do I do?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Hold up, I'm looking at my spit with a microscope.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: They want me to use real water in the eye wash scene.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: So?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I can't squirt stuff in my eyeball.  I've never even used an eye dropper.

quotes.speaker: Production Assistant
quotes.text: So Andy, so you know how to use this.  You step on the pedal, water squirts in your eyes.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Carla! Carla!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: It is time for a little T & A. I give you: Toby and Angela.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [throws plane far] Oh my god! Oh my god. Ok it's your turn. [Toby crumples plane and steps aside.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Well, Angela is the winner.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Yes!

quotes.speaker: Esther
quotes.text: [to Dwight] Is there a reason that we're excited for that little woman?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes. I pity her. She was recently in a situation where she could have had it all, and instead she lost everything.

quotes.speaker: Esther
quotes.text: Oh. Is she a gambler?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: In a way.  But not in a stand up and cheer kind of way, like the song.

quotes.speaker: Esther
quotes.text: Hmm. That is sad.

quotes.speaker: Carla Fern
quotes.text: [grabs Andy by the cheeks] Andy! If you don't stick your eyes in that machine, I'm going to call every production in North Eastern Pennsylvania.  You won't even make an appearance on a security camera! [Andy starts to cry]

quotes.speaker: Producer
quotes.text: What's the hold up here?

quotes.speaker: Director
quotes.text: The actor's crying.

quotes.speaker: Producer
quotes.text: Oh god.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: She yelled at me. I can't wash my eyeball. I can't do that. I can't.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Andy Bernard can't squirt water in his eye and act like it doesn't freak him out. But you know who can? Older Male Lab Assistant Number One.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Do you believe in me?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: I believe I want to go home.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [throws plane far] Yeah! Ok! Beat that! [Erin throws plane, loses, Dwight laughs] Whoo! Ok.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Dammit! Dammit, god. [To Pete] Sorry. Yeah I'm fine. I'm fine. I got mad. Cause I don't like losing. I'm just gonna- Sorry I'm mad! I'm mad, I'm really mad. I wanted to win. We were gonna win a lot of money, I was gonna buy you a sweater. It's stupid. Just the whole contest is stupid. That's how it feels.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Yeah. [Erin kicks box] Whoa!

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Sorry I'm mad! I don't like losing! I thought I was going to win!

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Ok [tries to help her] Hey hey hey, whoa.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Sorry. Sorry. I'm going to go upstairs and just...

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Oh, I made us a date to take my mom out to dinner to thank her for all that extra babysitting.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Well, you know how much I appreciate the opportunity to hang out with your mom more. So let me just put this in my calendar.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I acknowledge with gratitude that you are being kind and responsible enough to include it in your calendar.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thank you. Your mom is a treasure.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, I appreciate that some opportunities can be unpleasant- [Jim's phone rings, he answers]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey that's work, hold on. Hey Wade, did Cole Hamels call back or what? Great. Good.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh, to speak my truth, I'd appreciate if you hung that up cause we were in the middle of a conversation. [Jim hangs up phone] I appreciate the sacrifice.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ok to speak my truth, that was a little sarcastic. I think that's a little unfair.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Really? I've been putting the kids to bed by myself every night for a months. And you had to miss one phone call. Is that your truth, Jim? That's really your truth?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I guess I will swallow my truth.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Are you guys high? Because if so, to speak my truth, I would appreciate the sacrifice of including me in some hits off your kind buds.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: We're not high.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I wish we'd started this exercise six months ago. My heart just feels so... blocked up.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: The Mark 47 is ready for launch. [throws plane but it sticks to his hand] Less paste.

quotes.speaker: Director
quotes.text: Here we go. Rolling and... action!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [doing eyewash] AHHH! AHHH! AHHH! AHHH!!

quotes.speaker: Director
quotes.text: And cut. We can fix the sound in post.

quotes.speaker: Producer
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I can do a better one.

quotes.speaker: Producer
quotes.text: That's fine, we'll move on.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I said I can do a better one. Darryl...

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Action!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [eyewashes again] AHH! AHH! AHH!

quotes.speaker: Carla Fern
quotes.text: Kid can act!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah! Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Each contestant will throw two aeroplanes.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: After you.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Thank you. [plane loops up and falls at her feet] Oh god!

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Angela's first throw, terrible. Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [fake throws and drops plane] Oh! Oh man! It slipped out of my hand, what a whiff. Ah, how'd that happen? God. [Angela smiles]

quotes.speaker: Esther
quotes.text: We want you to win. Dwight told me about your situation. It's such a pity. Use the money wisely. [Angela looks disgusted]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Alright.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Don't you dare tank this. [Dwight throws plane far, Angela fake throws and drops her plane]

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: And we have a winner. And it's Dwight. And it is everyone because this is over.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: Two grand huh? I know a guy who can turn that into eight hundred dollars. And it's me.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [To Esther] Well, I guess you needed the money more than me huh? Use it wisely.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: I was disappointed in Dwight today. He showed a weakness that was unbecoming. Even if he did do it for me. I don't need pity and I don't need charity. I have my dignity and that's enough. And as long as I have that, I'll be ok.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I know this was really weird, and it was really hard. But I think we're making progress. So I'm really sorry that I have to go but let's keep at this. Ok?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Ok. [intense moment where Jim leaves and Pam seems conflicted.  She notices his umbrella and runs out to follow him]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Jim! [hands him umbrella]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thanks.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Alright, have a good trip.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Bye.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Bye. [walks away]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Hey! [Runs after her and looks into her eyes] I... [hugs her tightly, Pam doesn't hug back]

quotes.speaker: Pastor
quotes.text: [Flashback to Jim & Pam's wedding] Love suffers long and is kind. It is not proud. Love bears all things, believes all things, hopes all things, endures all things. Love never fails. [Pam hugs Jim back finally] And now these three remain: Faith, hope and love. But the greatest of these is love. [Pam kisses Jim]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I love you.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I love you.
